greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of compositions of n with k parts p at position p (fixed points), n>=0, 0<=k<=n.
comment: In general, column k is asymptotic to c(k) * 2^n. The constants c(k) numerically:
reference: M. Archibald, A. Blecher and A. Knopfmacher, Fixed points in compositions and words, accepted by the Journal of Integer Sequences.
link: Joerg Arndt and Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10010 (rows 0..140, flattened)
M. Archibald, A. Blecher, and A. Knopfmacher, Fixed Points in Compositions and Words, J. Int. Seq., Vol. 23 (2020), Article 20.11.1.
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, expand(
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..n))(b(n, 1)):
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n == 0, 1, Expand[Sum[b[n-j, i+1]*If[i == j, x, 1], {j, 1, n}]]]; T[n_] := Function[{p}, Table[Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, n}]][b[n, 1]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 15}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 06 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Cf. A238352 for the same statistics for partitions.
results.author: _Joerg Arndt_ and _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 25 2014
